result.title: Linux prevent Root Login
result.content:
It is very dangerous to allow ssh remote login with root. Because in this case, some one may break your root password with brute force method.

We can do this to prevent the root's login from remote ssh : change your /etc/ssh/sshd_config file, and add this line.

auth required pam_succeed_if.so user != root quiet

after that, restart your sshd service: service sshd restart

It works fine in CentOS 7.

You can find more ways by this reference : https://access.redhat.com/documentation/zh-CN/Red_Hat_Enterprise_Linux/7/html/Security_Guide/sec-Controlling_Root_Access.html
